reviews.text: We recently to watch a showing of Home Alone 2 with our Cub Scout Pack (505). We enjoyed sodas (adults) and bottled water as well as popcorn. The screen was an appropriate size and audio was really good. Seats do not have cup holders but this is an old theater. Facilities are nice. Movie was super cheap at $2.12 per person.
This is a local favorite for plays, performances, and movies! Being there stirs nostalgia for years gone by. It's a Bowling Green treasure! It would use a concession stand! :)

I saw the 50th anniversary of the Yellow Submarine movie, and I loved it. I love that it's a cute local theater, I hope to return to it sometime for another show. My only complaint is that it was pretty hot in the building, I'm sure it was due to the many people in there and it was hot outside, so I can't discount any stars for that.
So much history in downtown Bowling Green Ky. Love movie nights!
A great place to go. We love classics theaters and classic movies.

What a great way to spend our Friday afternoon. Me and my love went for lunch and decided to take in the Garden today. What a great idea that turn out to be. We meet some of the smart school age child on a field trip. We watching an artist paint a piece of art live. We bird watched say and read the paper and listen to the fountain stream water. If you have never experienced this Free part of Dixon Gallery and Garden , then you are missing an absolute master piece. Trust me on this one the kids will be thanking you for years and it's so romantic. Next, week we explore the Dixon original family seating area.

Compared to its neighbor, Memphis Botanical Gardens, it’s small but very attractive. The small garden area is a delight even in October when it’s 90 degrees outside. Does the south have fall? Nonetheless, the walk in the garden and the impressionist artwork in the mansion are worth the time. Here’s a tip: if you are a member of a reciprocal botanical Garden you get in free. Bonus.

This is a great place for a pleasant garden walk and a beautiful art gallery. There is a permanent exhibit, of course, but I enjoy the temporary exhibits that come through. The variety is good in terms of media and culture.
I've been to several work-related conferences in the meeting room, which is a delightful setting.
Saturday mornings before noon admission is free, so we drop by for a leisurely stroll through about once a month.
During the summers, Food Truck Fridays are a lot of fun as well.

It is very fun and the employees are very nice. And they also are very funny and have fun with their customers ant the same time. I really would prefer families to come explore. What is in this Gallery.
Tulips are in full bloom. The wife and I took our daughter to have her picture made. Gorgeous!

It is truly amazing to have a sidetrip when we are on our way to Chicago from Nashville.  

Outside this museum is very inviting! Really was amazed and mesmerized by the car displays inside the museum.  Place is well maintained and is very clean. Its so inspiring to see the series of Corvette cars. Truly worth visiting!

I want to be back here!

I visited while visiting a friend in Auburn. It was cool to see all of the different cars but the COOLEST PART was the exhibit about the sinkhole. There was a part where you could see how far down the hole went, ans you could experience the sinkhole while it was happening inside this cave area. I'm not super into cars so the majority of the exhibits were pretty to look at but I couldn't appreciate them as much as someone else might. Still a must in Bowling Green though.

It has been several years since I have been but this was a great day trip from Nashville.  Years of Corvettes and memorabilia showcasing the great American sports car.  Additionally to keep the museum educational an exhibit on dinosaurs.  I would like to go back to see the sink hole.

The National Corvette Museum is a staple visit for anyone interested in museums, car history, or Corvettes. It was around $10 to tour and you tour at your own pace. Depending on whether you read every description at the displays, it should take 1.5-2.5 hours to walk through. The best part of the museum was being able to sit in a brand new Corvette at the very end of the museum tour. They also apparently do events at the museum.

This place was amazing.  Went with my 9 and 11 year olds who loved it. Hands on exhibits, video, interactive displays ... A very thoughtfully presented museum suitable for just about anyone.  We LOVED most the display and back story about their sinkhole and the integration of this tragedy to their displays.  This is very clearly a modern, fun type of museum with a focus on engaging all audiences.  We spent 2-3 hours there.

If your in the area and looking for a nice spot to sit for a second try it out. Another good sitting spot is the side yard of the county clerk's office. Take note of the old iron fences in the area too.
Quaint little park right in the heart of the city. A wonderful place to sit and watch the paint dry.

Totally renovated fountain and brick pavers.  Wow, they made a good place better.  Many of the locals get family and wedding pictures  shot there because of the picturesque perspectives.  Shop the area for galleries, favorite local restaurants,  and even fantastic chocolate shop (Mary Jane's Chocolates).
Was first visit. Nice little park. Was a cold day so we didn't stay long
Such a wonderful little square! They have it decorated beautifully for the holidays this year. Perfect spot to go with friends!

We were on vacation in cave city and couldn't find one good restaurant. A local recommended this place and we were not disappointed. It had great food and not real expensive. Our waiter was very attentive. If we are ever in the area we will be back.

First time there... I gotta say I wish I had tried it sooner. Exceptionally friendly staff, fun outdoorsy atmosphere. Service alone was worth the 5 stars. Good was great. Aside done of the wall fixtures being in need of a good dusting (especially the moose head over the fire place), great place for family or romantic dining.

The first wonderful aspect is the ambiance. It has the feel that you are in the Yellowstone lodge . The huge beams and timber structure will entertain you while you wait for a sumptuous array of culinary bliss. The food is straight forward and seasoned with perfection. The menu is large and diverse. From the entrees to the appetizers, your taste will dance while your eyes are tantilized by the ambiance. The service is professional and friendly. The price is in line with the fare. I highly recommend this pleasant venue. It makes the meal an event.
The ambience here is nice. Log cabin style, nice aroma of the wood grill as soon as you enter. The steak I had was top notch. I liked it so much I went 3 times in the 2 weeks I was in the area.

The steaks are always the exact cut and cooked to order.  The rostisserie chicken is absolutely amazing as well; you can watch it cook over the fire as you eat.  All side items are fresh.  The bartenders are welcoming.  I've sat both in a booth and at the bar; there's no problems with either.  Lastly, the prices aren't extravagant and worth every penny, including drinks.

Riley's Bakery saved the day! The previous bakery I placed an order with several weeks ago called the day before I needed the cake and cancelled on me. I called Riley's Bakery and the nice lady on the phone said that she could have me a cake ready early the day that I needed it. The cake was just how I wanted and everyone complimented on how delicious it was. Thanks Riley's Bakery!

This is the best bakery I’ve ever been to. A variety of bakery items and they’re all fabulous. I highly recommend you visit this Bowling Green landmark. You will NOT be sorry. There’s no place like it.
I've never had a bad product from here. The selection is extensive enough to satisfy but restrained enough not to overwhelm. I love the olive nut sandwich.
Probably the best bakery I've ever been to! Consistent quality, nice, helpful staff, can't say anything negative. You can't get this on the internet!
5 stars just cause those crazy good tea cup cookies.

Outstanding flavors.    Dinners are a little steeper in price than what we are used to for this area, but the food is outstanding and portions are so generous that we can share plates.   Some of the best sauces I’ve had at any Indian restaurant I’ve visited.   Very friendly staff, too.   And the lunchtime buffet is PERFECT!   Lots to choose from at a very reasonable cost.

Nice selection on the buffet. The food was fresh and well prepared.  The staff was friendly, courteous, and attentive. Nice dining atmosphere.  Check them out if you are in the area and looking for Indian food. :)

I came back to this establishment thinking they had changed hands, but it looks like they aren't part of a franchise anymore?  Anyways, the food was still delicious, albeit not as spicy, my tongue thanked me! They were my #174, the new place is #286.
Delicious Indian cuisine! We have visited an assortment of Indian restaurants in several states and this is one of if not the best. The naan is divine. Definitely recommend.
I've been enjoying Indian food for years from all over the United States. This is arguably some of the best Indian food my wife and I have had. Lots of variety and excellent prices!

Local folks all recommended this place as perhaps Bowling Green's best barbeque. They were very correct! This no frills place has outstanding ribs, shoulder, brisket, pulled pork... and more! Don't wait until a half hour before close: they do occasionally run out of their best items. we had the pulled pork and the brisket-- which we to die for! The smoke ring on the meat was nearly 3/4 of an inch! Your meal comes with two sides-- we liked the homemade mashed potatoes and the vinegar slaw the best. And if you order a large drink, it's a full litre (32 oz.) Treat yourself by dining in and sit in the back area of the restaurant. The view of a deep gorge and river is beautiful! Service is polite, friendly, and fast. Dine in or carry out.

What can you say about a restaurant that has been in business for years and is always packed? This place is GREAT. Classic atmosphere, killer BBQ, huge portions, fantastic sides. The best of the best of it's type. Always fun. The "Dipped" (hot) will light you up.

Great all around. The brisket, pulled pork, and half chicken were all phenomenal. The sauces were delicious - try the hit vinegar, one of the best barbecue sauces I've ever had! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful as well. 5/5 would recommend.
I love bbq. Glad we stopped for lunch here. Tried brisket and ribs. Would have them both again.
Amazing sunroom seating high over the Barren River!  Cool view, fantastic food!  Try the half a chicken!!!
